page.title: 10BOSLEY WOOD TREATMENT MILL
page.content: In the N.E. corner of our area there is a wood flour mill. This was originally a water powered corn mill which in 1927 the Thompstone family , for economic reasons turned into wood flour mill. Wood shaving and sawdust are ground and sifted into powder , then bagged and delivered to industries making linoleum and plastics . In 1936 the mill began grinding mica imported from China and Brazil now coconut shells from Sri Lanka and Mozambique and Guar from Pakistan are ground and used in industry. Wood treatment is the largest source of employment in Bosley and employs 102 people . Of these approximately 10 are local .The wood flour plant is now fully automatic which has meant the loss of 20 jobs however automation has increased the importance of skilled engineers.
